member.name: T:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi
member.summary: You can interact with Players in your world through the VRCPlayerApi. Each Player has a VRCPlayerApi Object. The VRCPlayerApi Class also has static methods for getting various information about Players in the instance.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerCount
member.summary: Gets the number of Players in the instance when it is called.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.returns: The number of players in the instance.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.IsValid
member.summary: If a player has left since you saved a reference to them, this will return False.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.returns: True if the player is valid to use, false if it is not.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.EnablePickups(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Turn off the Player's ability to pickup and use VRCPickup objects in the world. This property is on by default, so you only need to use the method if you want to turn it off.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: F:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.displayName
member.summary: Get the name displayed for the Player (can be different than Username, which is used to log into VRChat and not exposed publicly)
member.remarks: This value may return the string: "<uninitialized>" if the player is not valid. Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: F:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.isLocal
member.summary: Tells you whether the given Player is the local one.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: P:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.isMaster
member.summary: Tells you whether the given Player is the instance master.
member.remarks: This is the player who either created the instance, or the one who inherited Master status when the last Master left. Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPickupInHand(VRC.SDKBase.VRC_Pickup.PickupHand)
member.summary: Gets the pickup a Player is holding in the specified hand. Only works for the Local Player.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: The hand to check for a pickup. . Any is not supported.
member.returns: The object the player is holding in the specified hand. Returns null if no VRCPickup is found.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.IsOwner(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Tells you whether a Player is the Owner of a given GameObject, important for Sync.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: The GameObject to check ownership of.
member.returns: True if the player is the owner of the GameObject, false if they are not.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.IsUserInVR
member.summary: Tells you whether a Player is using a VR headset.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.returns: True if the player is using a VR headset, false if they are not.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.PlayHapticEventInHand(VRC.SDKBase.VRC_Pickup.PickupHand,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Vibrate the Player's Haptic controllers if they have them.
member.remarks:
The feeling can vary quite a bit between controllers.
All 3 parameters MUST be positive.
Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: The duration of the vibration in seconds.
The amplitude of the vibration. 0.0 to 1.0.
The frequency of the vibration. 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.UseAttachedStation
member.summary: Makes the player get into the Station which is on the same GameObject as this UdonBehaviour.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.UseLegacyLocomotion
member.summary:
WARNING: This method is not recommended to be used.
turns on legacy locomotion for this player.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.CombatGetCurrentHitpoints
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED AND NON-FUNCTIONAL! DO NOT USE!
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetCurrentLanguage
member.summary: Gets the selected language of the local user.
member.remarks:
This feature isnt added to the client yet, so it currently is not useful.
Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.returns: Currently returns a example string. Will throw an exception in clientsim currently.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetAvailableLanguages
member.summary: Gets all available languages a player can select.
member.remarks:
This feature isnt added to the client yet, so it currently is not useful.
Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.returns: Currently returns a example string[]. Will throw an exception in clientsim currently.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerCount
member.summary: Gets the actual number of Players in the instance when it is called.
member.remarks:
This will return the value BEFORE the current function update. For example, if called in OnPlayerLeave, it will return the ammount of players in the instance right BEFORE that player left.
Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.returns: The number of players in the instance.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayers(VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi[])
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a VRCPlayerApi object for the given player Id if it exists.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: The player Id to get the VRCPlayerApi object for.
member.returns: The VRCPlayerApi object for the given player Id if it exists, null otherwise.

member.name: P:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.playerId
member.summary: Get the cached PlayerId, calls GetPlayerId if it hasn't been cached yet.
member.remarks:
Currently, this seems to behave identically to .
Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.value: The Network Id of the player. Always increments, even if the player leaves and rejoins.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerId(VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi)
member.summary: Gets the Player's Network Id from the source.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: The player to get the Network Id for.
member.returns: The Network Id of the player. Always increments, even if the player leaves and rejoins.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetPlayerTag(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sets a string variable that you can look up later.
For example, you could set the "role" of a player in a cooking game to "chef" or "customer". Then you could GetPlayerTag for "role" and get back either "chef" or "customer".
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: The name of the tag to set.
The value of the tag to set.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerTag(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a tag that was set with SetPlayerTag.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: The name of the tag to set.
member.returns: The value of the tag as a string.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.ClearPlayerTags
member.summary: Remove all tags that you've set on this player.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayersWithTag(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: NOT CURRENTLY FUNCTIONAL! DO NOT USE, WILL THROW EXPOSURE EXCEPTION!
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: The name of the tag to get the players for.

The value of the tag to get the players for?????????
Unknown if this is even what it does.
member.returns: A list type of VRCPlayerApi objects that have the tag set.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceGain(System.Single)
member.summary: Add boost to the Player's voice in decibels.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceDistanceNear(System.Single)
member.summary: The near radius, in meters, where volume begins to fall off. It is strongly recommended to leave the Near value at zero for realism and effective spatialization for user voices.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceDistanceFar(System.Single)
member.summary: This sets the end of the range for hearing the user's voice. You can lower this to make another player's voice not travel as far, all the way to 0 to effectively 'mute' the player.
member.remarks: Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceVolumetricRadius(System.Single)
member.summary: A player's voice is normally simulated to be a point source, however changing this value allows the source to appear to come from a larger area.
member.remarks:
This should be used carefully, and is mainly for distant audio sources that need to sound "large" as you move past them. Keep this at zero unless you know what you're doing. If you want a user's voice to sound like it is close no matter how far it is, increase the Voice Distance Near range to a large value.
Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: in Meters, Range is 0 - 1,000. Default is 0. The value for Volumetric Radius should always be lower than Voice Distance Far.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceLowpass(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disables the low-pass filter on the player's voice.
member.remarks:
When a voice is some distance off, it is passed through a low-pass filter to help with understanding noisy worlds. You can disable this if you want to skip this filter. For example, if you intend for a player to use their voice channel to play a high-quality DJ mix, turning this filter off is advisable.
Checkout the Official Documentation page for more information.
member.param: True to enable? the low-pass filter, false? to disable it.
